title: JJ Abrams promises The Rise Of Skywalker will wrap up Star Wars saga
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

JJ Abrams has promised Star Wars fans an ’emotional and meaningful’ end to the Skywalker saga with the upcoming episode nine.

The saga has spanned five decades but will come to an end this December with the close of the story of Rey, Kylo Ren, Finn, and Luke Skywalker.

But director JJ, who will return after bringing the series back to the big screen in 2016 with The Force Awakens, has admitted that although ‘endings are the thing that scare me the most’ he hopes the film will provide answers for many of the lingering questions remain for fans as he ‘went into this thing knowing it has to be an ending’.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘This is about bringing this thing to a close in a way that is emotional and meaningful and also satisfying in terms of actually answering [as many] questions as possible,’ he said.

‘So if years from now, someone’s watching these movies, all nine of them, they’re watching a story that is as cohesive as possible.’

Daisy Ridley, from left, John Boyega and Oscar Isaac are all returning (Picture: AP)

He told EW: ‘While there were many things that were planned for and discussed — George Lucas himself said when he created this he saw it as three, three-act plays — that doesn’t mean there isn’t discovery, that doesn’t mean there aren’t things that come up that make you realise, “oh, here’s an opportunity.”

‘It also doesn’t mean that there’s a list of payoffs that we have to do because of setups.’

On the set of Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker (Picture: Vanity Fair)

Daisy Ridley, John Boyega, Oscar Isaac, and Adam Driver will all return for the film, while newcomers include Naomi Ackie, Richard E. Grant and Keri Russell.

Ackie recently revealed the extent of secrecy around the latest epic, Episode IX, The Rise Of Skywalker, with the Lady Macbeth star admitting the set was on near lockdown, with the cast only being able to spy the script twice.

Ackie recently revealed the extent of secrecy around the latest epic (Picture: AP)

Suppose it’s more generous than the Avengers cast members, who didn’t get to see the whole thing, or Game Of Thrones stars who had theirs essentially self-destruct after a certain period.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘They’re very on lockdown, we never got to take a script home, no way,’ Naomi told Metro.co.uk at the global launch of Triple Force Friday this week.

‘I got to read the script twice.’

She continued: ‘You retain information, each day that you’re on set you get what you need to do the day’s work. But its nice because when I see the film now, because of my memory they’ve faded away and I get to relive it with everyone else.’

Ackie is taking on the role of Jannah in the JJ Abrams-directed finale to the Skywalker saga, her character’s role in the fight against the First Order still shrouded in mystery.

The Rise Of Skywalker is in cinemas December.

description: JJ Abrams promises Star Wars fans an 'emotional and meaningful' end to the Skywalker saga.
